div.p: SCIRRHUS, in ſurgery and medicine, a hard tumor of any part of the body, void of pain, ariſing, as is ſuppoſed, from the inſpiſſation and induration of the fluids contained in a gland, though it may alſo appear in any other part of the body, eſpecially in the fat; being one of the ways in which an inflammation terminates. Theſe tumors are exceedingly apt to degenerate into cancers.
